mdRecord.dcterms:description: ...built in 1901 for Alfred Lyttelton, to designs by Sir Edwin Lutyens. It has been run as a hotel since 1948. The Hon. Alfred Lyttelton (1857â€“1913) served as a Member of Parliament from 1895 to 1913, holding office as Colonial Secretary from 1903 to 1905. Lutyens also laid out the gardens, possibly with the assistance of Gertrude Jekyll. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greywalls [work]
